Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy and describe how it has water and light.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy and describe how it does not have water.
The student can draw a sun or a light source to show that plants need light to grow.
The student can draw water or raindrops to show that plants need water to grow.
The student can label the parts of the plant in their drawing (such as roots, stem, and leaves).
The student can draw two plants side by side to compare one with water and light and one without.
CANNOT: The student may have minor gaps in labeling, such as missing labels for smaller parts like veins on leaves *(incomplete labeling due to detail focus)*.
The student might inconsistently depict the condition of soil in the unhealthy plant as overly dry or cracked *(attempts to show detail but occasionally misses subtle differences)*.
